Sociolinguist

People talk funny. Why?

Everyone knows about dialects, and how sometimes you can tell where someone is from based on how they speak. But can we do the same with data from the Internet? Research says yes, and I'm eager to find out more.

I'm a graduate student at Georgia Tech looking to study language variation through the lens of social media. This entails (1) developing strategies to handle "noisy" natural language data and (2) applying relevant sociolinguistic theory to explain patterns in variation. I am especially interested in unifying social network theory with that of speech communities (both real and virtual).

Check out my research!
